taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe galinsoginae;genus galinsoga;species parviflora;variety semicalva

taxon_name.authority: (A. Gray) H. St. John & D. White

bio:treatment.description: Plants 4–35 cm. Leaf blades lance-olate to ovate, 7–55(–80) × 3–20 mm, margins usually entire or serrulate, sometimes serrate. Arrays of heads congested. Axillary peduncles shorter than subtending bractlets. 2n = 32.
bio:treatment.discussion: Plants of var. semicalva are less branched and usually have narrower leaves and shorter axillary peduncles than those of var. parviflora. They are found above 1500 m as far south as Distrito Federal, Mexico. Morphologic intermediates between the diploid var. parviflora and the tetraploid var. semicalva occur throughout the range of var. semicalva.
